newsitem.title: UK: S.Africa Q1 sugar exports above production -ISO.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa Q1 sugar exports above production -ISO.

text.p: South Africa exported 69,174 tonnes of sugar in the first three months of 1997, after just 8,527 tonnes in the same period in 1996, the International Sugar Organization (ISO) said on Friday.
But production during the period was lower at 57,778 tonnes, compared with 81,071 tonnes in January/March 1996, it said.

End-month sugar stocks fell by 305,617 tonnes from December 1996 to stand at 975,400 tonnes in March 1997. Consumption reached 294,221 tonnes in the first quarter of this year after an equivalent 277,873 tonnes in 1996.
Destinations of the first quarter sugar exports were unknown, the ISO said.
